    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Sets the instance variable hotel to a well-defined initial value.
      void testCheckInWithCorrectPassword()
      checkIn must, as long as rooms are available, return a room occupied by the specified guest.
      void testCheckInWithWrongPassword()
      checkIn must return null is the password is wrong.
      void testCheckoutEmptyRoom() 
      void testCheckoutOccupiedRoom()
      If the specified guest is checked in, he must be checked out, i.e., afterwards, he must not have a room anymore, and his room must now be empty.
      void testGetFreeRoomFromFullHotel()
      If there is no free room, getFreeRoom must return null.
      void testGetFreeRoomFromNotFullHotel()
      If there is a free room, getFreeRoom must return a room without guest.
      void testGetPassword()
      A password object must be returned.
      void testGetRoomAfterCheckIn()
      If the guest is checked in, the returned room must be occupied by the specified guest.
      void testGetRoomBeforeCheckIn()
      getRoom must not return any room, if the guest is not checked in
      void testToString()
      ToString is difficult to test fully because there is no restriction on the format of the returned String.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HotelTest

        public HotelTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Sets the instance variable hotel to a well-defined initial value. All test methods should be preceded by a call to this method.

      • testCheckInWithWrongPassword

        public void testCheckInWithWrongPassword()
        checkIn must return null is the password is wrong.

      • testCheckInWithCorrectPassword

        public void testCheckInWithCorrectPassword()
        checkIn must, as long as rooms are available, return a room occupied by the specified guest. When the hotel is full, checkIn must return null.

      • testCheckoutOccupiedRoom

        public void testCheckoutOccupiedRoom()
        If the specified guest is checked in, he must be checked out, i.e., afterwards, he must not have a room anymore, and his room must now be empty. The room's safe must be inactivated as well.

      • testCheckoutEmptyRoom

        public void testCheckoutEmptyRoom()

      • testGetFreeRoomFromNotFullHotel

        public void testGetFreeRoomFromNotFullHotel()
        If there is a free room, getFreeRoom must return a room without guest.

      • testGetFreeRoomFromFullHotel

        public void testGetFreeRoomFromFullHotel()
        If there is no free room, getFreeRoom must return null.

      • testGetRoomBeforeCheckIn

        public void testGetRoomBeforeCheckIn()
        getRoom must not return any room, if the guest is not checked in

      • testGetRoomAfterCheckIn

        public void testGetRoomAfterCheckIn()
        If the guest is checked in, the returned room must be occupied by the specified guest.

      • testGetPassword

        public void testGetPassword()
        A password object must be returned.

      • testToString

        public void testToString()
        ToString is difficult to test fully because there is no restriction on the format of the returned String. At least it can be tested that a String is returned and that it contains the name of a checked in guest.
